nodes.title: Mars
nodes.summary: Data about Mars with easy programmatic access

nodes.title: the Books
nodes.summary: The history book of everything: Editor Guided

nodes.title: Bot to show Martian Time every day
Expand to see a list of thought distortions
nodes.summary: Descriptions by Irismar Reis de Oliveira; https://tinyurl.com/y4apuybg

nodes.title: Fortune telling (aka catastrophizing)
nodes.summary: I predict the future in negative terms and believe that what will happen will be so awful that I will not be able to stand it.

nodes.title: Concluding thoughts
nodes.summary: The above evidence makes me conclude that...

nodes.title: Conclusion
nodes.summary: [What do you conclude from the evidence?]

nodes.title: Selective abstraction (aka mental filter or tunnel vision)
nodes.summary: I pay attention to one or a few details and fail to see the whole picture.

nodes.title: Unfair comparisons
nodes.summary: I compare myself with others who seem to do better than I do and place myself in a disadvantageous position.

nodes.title: 4. For each distorted thought, add supporting and contrary evidence and a conclusion
1. Fill in the details of the situation in which you had an undesirable reaction
nodes.summary: Add up to ten thoughts or emotions in each list to keep the analysis work manageable.

nodes.title: What do I notice in my body?
Blaming (others or oneself)
nodes.summary: I direct my attention to others as sources of my negative feelings and experiences, failing to consider my own responsibility; or conversely, I take responsibility for others behaviors and attitudes.

nodes.title: Magnification/minimization
nodes.summary: I evaluate myself, others, and situations magnifying the negatives and/or minimizing the positives

nodes.title: What do I feel in my body now?
Post-action emotions
nodes.summary: List out all the emotions that you feel as a result.

nodes.title: 2. Connect related thoughts with lines
nodes.summary: In doing so, see the thoughts that are the root of the issue.

nodes.title: 3. Refer to the thought distortions list and see if any of your thoughts match. Label your thoughts with all applicable distortions.
What do I notice in my body?
Personalizing
nodes.summary: I assume that others' behaviors and external events concern (or are directed to) myself without considering other plausible explanations.

nodes.title: Dichotomous thinking (also called all-or-nothing thinking)
nodes.summary: I view a situation, a person, or an event only in all-or-nothing terms, fitting them into only two extreme categories instead of on a continuum.

nodes.title: Should statements (also "musts," "oughts," "have to's")
nodes.summary: I tell myself that events, people's behaviors, and my own attitudes "should" be the way I expect them to be and not as they really are.

nodes.title: Discounting or disqualifying the positive
nodes.summary: I disqualify and discount positive experiences or events insisting that they do not count.

nodes.title: Emotions
nodes.summary: List out all the emotions you are feeling.

nodes.title: Thoughts
nodes.summary: List out all the thoughts that are going through your mind. It's best to break them down so you can analyze them separately later.

nodes.title: What if?
nodes.summary: I keep asking myself questions such as "what if something happens?"

nodes.title: Overgeneralization
nodes.summary: I take isolated cases and generalize them widely by means of words such as "always," "never," and "everyone."

nodes.title: Post-action thoughts
nodes.summary: List out all the thoughts that go through your mind after your initial reaction to them.

nodes.title: What do I intend to do now?
[Describe what is happening (aka the trigger)]
nodes.summary: Drag in a picture of the trigger to make this exercise even more real.

nodes.title: Labeling
nodes.summary: I put a fixed, global label, usually negative, on myself or others.

nodes.title: Jumping to conclusions
nodes.summary: I draw conclusions (negative or positive) from little or no confirmatory evidence.

nodes.title: Emotional reasoning
nodes.summary: I believe my emotions reflect reality and let them guide my attitudes and judgements

nodes.title: 0. Duplicate this template to make your own version to edit by clicking the three dot menu next to the map title.
Mind reading
nodes.summary: I believe that I know the thoughts or intentions of others (or that they know my thoughts or intentions) without having sufficient evidence.
